CABIN E T, ^--' ADMINISTRATION OF JUVENILE EMPLOYMENT COMMITTEES", __________________BUREAUX AND EXCHANGES*________Noto by tho Soorotory.With roforence to Cabinet 12(21) Conclusion 7, I circulate tho following answer given in tho House of Commons on 14th June, 1981, by Mr. Chamber Lain to a question asked by Lieutenant-Colonel NailLIEUTENANT-COLONEL NALL asked the Lord Privy Seal whether for soao years the Board of Education and the Ministry of Labour have maintained overlapping and antagonistic committees dealing with juvenile employment; and can immediate steps "be taken by the Government to alter this state of things?MR, CHAMBERLAIN: I am aware that better co-ordination between the work of the Local Education Authorities and of the Employment Exchanges, under . the Education (Choice of Employment) Act, 1910, and the Labour Exchange Act, 1909, in advising and \ assisting young persons in choosing and obtaining employment is required, and I am happy to say that Lord Chelmsford has accepted an invitation to inquire, into the matter on behalf of the Government with a view to arriving at an early settlement of the matter*It is understood that Lord Chelmsford will be assisted in the Enquiry by Assessors appointed by the Chancellor of the \ Exchequer, tho President cf the Board of Education and the Minister of Labour respectively^(Sgdo) M*P.A* Hankey*
